channel.title: üó≥ Evidence Collection And Preservation on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in üó≥ Evidence Collection And Preservation on Analyst

item.title: üìò Manual
item.description: TODO: Move this to methodology. Each OS and system type will have a separate section (see below).

item.title: üßº Media Sterilisation
item.description: Before copying evidence or making a disk image, one needs to sterilise the target media to ensure that data on that disk before this operation would not meddle with the evidence data.

item.title: üß∞ Acquisition Toolkit
item.description: If this system is running, capture the memory. Should be the first task. Memory stomping issues.

item.title: ‚õÖÔ∏è AWS Evidence Collection
item.description: Are there any Shadow Cloud Accounts? Could be the first place to look when investigating.

item.title: üçé iOS Evidence Collection
item.description: General Considerations First of all, all the Apple devices support remote wiping which has evolved significantly over the year and now support Bluetooth.

item.title: üçè Mac Evidence Collection
item.description: Order The order for collecting digital evidence on macOS and Linux-based systems during a forensic investigation is similar to that of Windows systems.

item.title: üêß Linux Evidence Collection
item.description: File Systems EXT 2,3,4, ReiserFS, XFS, JFS, Btrfs. Logical Backup - doesn’t copy all, doesn’t copy slack, free space and deleted files.

item.title: ü§ñ Android Evidence Collection
item.description: File System Logical Backup - doesn’t copy all, doesn’t copy slack, free space and deleted files.

item.title: ü™ü Windows Evidence Collection
item.description: Stacking - outlier analysis based on frequency. File Systems FAT12, 32, 64, NTFS, ReFS. Logical Backup - doesn’t copy all, doesn’t copy slack, free space and deleted files.

item.title: Collecting Containers
item.description: Containers are, by their nature, highly volatile. This property of containers runs contrary to the fundamental forensics need to preserve evidence.

item.title: Network Traffic
item.description: Most of the devices keep some sort of logs. As for the network related issues these are switches, routers, firewalls, IDS and IPS, web proxies, DC and authentication servers, DCHP server and application servers.

item.title: VM Acquisition
item.description: […]they all need to be backed by a disk image, which is a file that represents an entire raw physical disk.
